title: Africa: Why Africa's Fastest Sprinter Will Not Be Competing in Many Local Races As Opposed to Previous Seasons
description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- The African record holder for the men's 100m, Ferdinand Omanyala, reveals that he will not be competing in many local races in the new season as he sets sights on international competitions.

title: Africa: Explainer - Inside the New African Union Land Governance Strategy
description: [New Times] The African Union Commission (AUC), in collaboration with the Department of Agriculture, Rural Development, Blue Economy, and Sustainable Environment (DARBE), and the African Land Policy Centre (ALPC), has introduced a groundbreaking Land Governance Strategy (LGS).

title: Africa: Can Revised AU Policy Give Youth an Active Peacebuilding Role?
description: [ISS] The African Union and its member states must move beyond tokenism to ensure meaningful youth participation.

title: Africa: Pyramids Offensive Threat Forces Mazembe Rethink
description: [CAF] TP Mazembe coach Lamine Ndiaye admits his team cannot focus solely on defending when they face Pyramids' fearsome attack in Friday's TotalEnergies CAF Champions League encounter.

title: Africa: Member Associations Benefit From CAF ASFC Ball Distribution Drive
description: [CAF] With the second edition of the CAF African Schools Football Championship in full swing, Member Associations participating in the tournament have already reaped the rewards of being a part of this season's competition.

title: Africa: Pacheco Insists Pyramids Can Win Title Despite Giant Task
description: [CAF] Pyramids coach Jaime Pacheco believes his team can achieve TotalEnegies CAF Champions League glory at the first attempt, despite facing two former champions in a daunting group-stage draw.

title: Africa: Paqueta Issues Rallying Cry Ahead of Belouizdad's Group Stage Opener
description: [CAF] CS Belouizdad coach Marcos Paqueta has called on the Algerian club's passionate fans to roar them to victory in Friday's TotalEnergies CAF Champions League group stage opener against Young Africans.

title: Africa: Dangote Cement Positioned to Tackle Africa's Waste, Climate Change Issues - GMD
description: [Premium Times] Mr Pathak said cement production is an energy-intensive process which consumes thermal energy of about 3.3GJ/tonne of clinker produced.

title: Africa: Climate Crisis Exposes Vulnerabilities of Africa's Weak Infrastructure #AfricaClimateCrisis
description: [allAfrica] Two recent disasters in Morocco and Libya highlight the deadly consequences of outdated infrastructure in the face of natural hazards.

title: Africa: WAFU B Zone Set to Kick Off 2023/24 CAF African Schools Football Championship Zonal Qualifiers
description: [CAF] The anticipation is high as the West African Football Union (WAFU) B Zone is gearing up to host the upcoming edition of the CAF African Schools Football Championship from Thursday.

title: Africa: Minister Recognizes the Need to Transform Education in Africa
description: [ANGOP] Luanda -- Angola's Minister of Higher Education, Science, Technology and Innovation, Maria do Rosário Bragança, on Thursday acknowledged the need for urgent transformation of the African education system, with a view to offering greater quality and competence in the training of staff, for the development of the continent.

title: Africa: COP28 - Strengthen Climate Resilience in Small and Vulnerable Countries
description: [IPS] Karnataka, India -- With a focus on strengthening the resilience of small and vulnerable member countries, Unnikrishnan Nair says the Commonwealth Secretariat is working to align development and climate finance for maximum impact.

title: Africa: Drug Resistance May Make Common Infections Like Thrush Untreatable
description: [The Conversation Africa] Antimicrobial resistance is one of the biggest global threats to health, food security and development. This month, The Conversation's experts explore how we got here and the potential solutions.

title: Africa: Give Wildlife a Seat At the Table
description: [IPS] Uckfield, UK -- As we stand at a critical crossroads in climate change, we must recognise the inextricable link between nature and climate. This connection has been overlooked for far too long. IAR's COP28 campaign, 'Give Wildlife A Seat At The Table,' is gaining support from prominent figures such as Joanna Lumley, Peter Egan, and Jo Brand, who are joining forces with the organisation to address the urgent need for wildlife representation.

title: Africa: The Loss and Damage Fund Must Deliver At COP28
description: [ISS] Africans displaced by climate change desperately need support, but disputes over the fund's modalities could hinder progress.

title: Africa: African Women Won't Be Heard At Cop So We Wrote Our Own Climate Plan
description: [African Arguments] The Women's Climate Assembly brought together movements from across Africa and came up with a powerful declaration.
